required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Umbilical Cord Blood Mononuclear Cell Gel in the Treatment of Refractory Diabetic Foot Ulcer
clinical_study.official_title: The Efficacy and Safety of Umbilical Cord Blood Mononuclear Cell Gel in the Treatment of Refractory Diabetic Foot Ulcer.

brief_summary.textblock: Umbilical cord blood mononuclear cells (MNC) may improve the wound repair ability. This study aims to investigate the role of MNC in refractory diabetic foot ulcer by comparing the combination of PRP and MNC with PRP alone.

detailed_description.textblock: The difficulty in the healing of diabetic foot is related to the loss of local repair microenvironment. The platelet rich plasma (PRP) can improve the repair ability, however, the requirement for wound bed preparation is strict, or treatment failure may occur. Umbilical cord blood mononuclear cells (MNC) may provide a better repair environment through paracrine action. This study aims to investigate the role of MNC in refractory diabetic foot ulcer by comparing the combination of PRP and MNC with PRP alone.

primary_outcome.description: The ratio of the reduced area after one week of treatment to the original area

secondary_outcome.description: Percentage of patients with healed wound at 4 weeks
Percentage of patients with major amputation at 8 weeks

arm_group.description: The combination of PRP and MNC

intervention.intervention_name: Umbilical cord blood mononuclear cell gel（MNC）
intervention.description: Local wound treatment by combination of PRP and MNC, once;
Local wound treatment by PRP alone, once.

overall_official.affiliation: Peking University Third Hospital Wound Healing Center

patient_data.ipd_description: all IPD that underlie results in a publication
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: starting 6 months after publication, for 1 year
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: The IPD and supporting information will be shared by contact PI (Long Zhang)'s Email, upon the request of the scientific journal editor.
